ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.: Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.: The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

Concepts.definition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.
Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.
The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hospitalized On High Level Oxygen Therapy Or Noninvasive Mechanical Ventilation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hospitalized On High Level Oxygen Therapy Or Noninvasive Mechanical Ventilation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.: Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.: A response indicating a high level.: The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: In medicine, it describes a procedure that does not require inserting an instrument through the skin or into a body opening. In cancer, it describes disease that has not spread outside the tissue in which it began.: A method to mechanically assist or replace spontaneous breathing in patients by use of a powered device that forces oxygenated air into the lungs.

Concepts.definition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.
Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.
A response indicating a high level.
The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

In medicine, it describes a procedure that does not require inserting an instrument through the skin or into a body opening. In cancer, it describes disease that has not spread outside the tissue in which it began.
A method to mechanically assist or replace spontaneous breathing in patients by use of a powered device that forces oxygenated air into the lungs.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not Hospitalized Able to Resume Normal Activity of Daily Living

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not Hospitalized Able to Resume Normal Activity of Daily Living
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.: The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.: To take up or begin anew; resume.: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.: Those physical activities which are required for our daily existence. These include personal maintenance activities and activities for maintenance of our living space, as well as activities related to independent living.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
To take up or begin anew; resume.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Those physical activities which are required for our daily existence. These include personal maintenance activities and activities for maintenance of our living space, as well as activities related to independent living.
The cessation of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.: The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

Concepts.definition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not Hospitalized Unable to Resume Normal Activity of Daily Living

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not Hospitalized Unable to Resume Normal Activity of Daily Living
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.: To take up or begin anew; resume.: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.: Those physical activities which are required for our daily existence. These include personal maintenance activities and activities for maintenance of our living space, as well as activities related to independent living.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.
A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.
To take up or begin anew; resume.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Those physical activities which are required for our daily existence. These include personal maintenance activities and activities for maintenance of our living space, as well as activities related to independent living.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hospitalized On Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation Or Invasive Mechanical Ventilation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hospitalized On Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation Or Invasive Mechanical Ventilation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.: Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.: A technique that utilizes a device to pump a patient's blood outside of the body, oxygenate it, and return it to the body.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A medical procedure that invades (enters) the body, usually by cutting or puncturing the skin or by inserting instruments into the body.: A method to mechanically assist or replace spontaneous breathing in patients by use of a powered device that forces oxygenated air into the lungs.

Concepts.definition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.
Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.
A technique that utilizes a device to pump a patient's blood outside of the body, oxygenate it, and return it to the body.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A procedure requiring physical intrusion of the body.
A method to mechanically assist or replace spontaneous breathing in patients by use of a powered device that forces oxygenated air into the lungs.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
